data.enText: -ies

data.chText: 神秘的事物；不可理解之事；奥秘
data.enText: something that is difficult to understand or to explain

data.chText: 这是本世纪尚未解开的大奥秘之一。
data.enText: It is one of the great unsolved mysteries of this century.

data.chText: 他们的动机仍然是个谜。
data.enText: Their motives remain a mystery.

data.chText: 我真无法理解他们为什么会选他。
data.enText: It's a complete mystery to me why they chose him.

data.chText: 神秘的人（或事物）；陌生而有趣的人（或事物）
data.enText: a person or thing that is strange and interesting because you do not know much about them or it
He's a bit of a mystery.
There was a mystery guest on the programme.

data.chText: 这个乐队是由一个不为人知的人资助的。
data.enText: The band was financed by a mystery backer.
a mystery tour (= when you do not know where you are going)
the quality of being difficult to understand or to explain, especially when this makes sb/sth seem interesting and exciting

data.chText: 她的失踪引起了重重疑团。
data.enText: Mystery surrounds her disappearance.
His past is shrouded in mystery (= not much is known about it) .

data.chText: 这墨镜使她显得有些神秘。
data.enText: The dark glasses give her an air of mystery .
a story, a film/movie or a play in which crimes and strange events are only explained at the end
I enjoy murder mysteries.

data.chText: 秘密的宗教仪式；秘密知识
data.enText: secret religious ceremonies; secret knowledge

data.chText: 把我引进神秘的数学世界的老师
data.enText: the teacher who initiated me into the mysteries of mathematics
a religious belief that cannot be explained or proved in a scientific way
the mystery of creation

means: 陌生而有趣的人(或事物)

tr: something that baffles understanding and cannot be explained
example: how it got out is a mystery
it remains one of nature's secrets

tr: a story about a crime (usually murder) presented as a novel or play or movie

value.def: A mystery is something that is not understood or known about.

example.ex: The source of the gunshots still remains a mystery.
example.tran: 枪炮声来自何处仍是个谜。

value.tran: 谜;神秘的事物;难懂的事物

value.def: If you talk about the mystery of someone or something, you are talking about how difficult they are to understand or know about, especially when this gives them a rather strange or magical quality.

example.ex: It is an elaborate ceremony, shrouded in mystery.
example.tran: 仪式是精心筹划的，笼罩着一层神秘的色彩。

value.def: A mystery person or thing is one whose identity or nature is not known.

example.ex: The mystery hero immediately alerted police after spotting a bomb.
example.tran: 那个无名英雄发现炸弹后马上报了警。

value.def: A mystery is a story in which strange things happen that are not explained until the end.

example.ex: His fourth novel is a murder mystery set in London.
example.tran: 他的第四部小说讲述的是一起发生在伦敦的神秘谋杀案。

trans: 神秘人；神秘兵团；骇客兵团；神奇七壮士；神奇七战士
